race_comments: Kyle Busch won the Monster Energy All-Star Race at Charlotte Motor Speedway, his first victory in the non-points event. Kyle Larson won Stage 1 and 2. Jimmie Johnson won Stage 3. Before the start of the event, no cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.

Kyle Busch won the Monster Energy All-Star Race at Charlotte Motor Speedway, his first victory in the non-points event. Kyle Larson won Stage 1 and 2. Jimmie Johnson won Stage 3. Before the start of the event, no cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.

Kyle Busch won the Monster Energy All-Star Race at Charlotte Motor Speedway, his first victory in the non-points event. Kyle Larson won Stage 1 and 2. Jimmie Johnson won Stage 3. Before the start of the event, no cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.

Kurt Busch won the 59th running of the Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway, his 29th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: #48, 21, 27 (Backup Car)

Brad Keselowski won the QuikTrip Folds of Honor 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway, his 22nd career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race, no cars dropped to the rear of the field.

Martin Truex Jr. won Sunday's Kobalt 400 at Las Vegas Motor Speedway, his eighth career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: #10 (rear gear), #17 (backup car), #51 (transmission).

Ryan Newman won the Camping World 500, his 18th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: No. 11 (unapproved tire change), No. 43 (engine change).

Kyle Larson won the Auto Club 400, his second victory in 116 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series races. Prior to the green flag to start the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: Nos. #88, #27 (Unapproved Tire Change), #38 (Backup Car), #33 (Transmission Change).

Brad Keselowski won the STP 500 at Martinsville Speedway, his 23rd career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior the start of the race, the following car dropped to the rear of the field for the reason indicated: No. 19 (backup car).

Jimmie Johnson won the 21st Annual O'Reilly Auto Parts 500, his 81st victory in 550 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series races. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: No. 5 (backup car), No. 6 (backup car) and No. 48 (unapproved tire change).

Jimmie Johnson won the Food City 500, his 82nd Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the green flag to start the race, the following car dropped to the rear of the field for the reason indicated: No. 37 (backup).

Joey Logano won the Toyota Owners 400 at Richmond International Raceway, his 18th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: Nos. 22 (Transmission Change) and 3 (Inspection Penalty).

Ricky Stenhouse Jr. won the 48th Annual GEICO 500, his first victory in 158 NASCAR Monster Energy Cup Series races. Prior to the start of the race, the following car dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: No. 75 (unapproved tire change).

Martin Truex Jr. won the 7th Annual Go Bowling 400, his ninth victory in 416 NASCAR Monster Energy Cup Series races. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: No. 32 (tire change), No. 95 (engine change).

Ryan Blaney won the Axalta presents the Pocono 400 at Pocono Raceway, his first career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field reasons indicated: No. 78 and 88 (engine change) and No.17 (unapproved adjustments).

Kyle Larson wins the FireKeepers Casino 400 at Michigan International Speedway, his third Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field for the reason(s) indicated: Nos. 34, 47, 48 (backup cars) 41, 4 (unapproved body modification) and 19 (unapproved tire change).

Kevin Harvick wins the Toyota - Save Mart 350 at Sonoma Raceway, his 36th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field for the reason(s) indicated: Nos. 20 (engine change) and 23 (missing driver intros).

race_name: Quaker State 400 Presented by Advance Auto Parts
race_comments: Martin Truex Jr. won the Quaker State 400 at Kentucky Speedway, his 10th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following car dropped to the rear of the field for the reason indicated: No. 31 (engine change).
Race complete

Kasey Kahne won the Brantley Gilbert Big Machine Brickyard 400 at Indianapolis Motor Speedway, his 18th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field for the reason(s) indicated: Nos. 48, 72 (rear gear change), 15 (engine change).

Kyle Busch won the Overton's 400 at Pocono Raceway, his 39th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: Nos. 33 (unapproved adjustments) and No. 55 (missed drivers meeting).

race_name: I LOVE NEW YORK 355 at The Glen
race_comments: Martin Truex Jr. won the I LOVE NEW YORK 355 at Watkins Glen International, his 11th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following car dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: Nos. 6, 32, 33, 27, 31, 15, 11, 14 (unapproved adjustments).

race_name: Bass Pro Shops NRA Night Race
race_comments: Kyle Busch won the UNOH 200 at Bristol Motor Speedway, his 49th victory in the NASCAR Camping World Truck Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: No.1 (engine change) and No. 52 (missing driver crew chief meeting).

Kyle Larson won the Pure Michigan 400 at Michigan International Speedway, his fourth Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Before the start of the event, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field for the reason(s) indicated: Nos. 5 and 48 (backup car); #32 (multiple pre-qualifying inspection failure).

Jeremy Clements won the Johnsonville 180 at Road America, his first victory in the NASCAR XFINITY Series. Prior to the start of the race, the No. 01 car dropped to the rear of the field for missing driver introductions.
Kyle Larson won the Federated Auto Parts 400 at Richmond Raceway, his fifth Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the green flag, no cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.

Martin Truex Jr. won the Tales of the Turtles 400 at Chicagoland Speedway, his 12th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 66, 77 (unapproved tire change).

Kyle Busch won the ISM Connect 300 at New  Hampshire Motor Speedway, his 41st Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the green flag, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: No. 13 (backup car), No. 34 and 37 (transmission change).
